Package meka.core.converters

Class MultiLabelTextDirectoryLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.core.converters.AbstractLoader
      • meka.core.converters.MultiLabelTextDirectoryLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    weka.core.CommandlineRunnable, weka.core.converters.BatchConverter, weka.core.OptionHandler

    public class MultiLabelTextDirectoryLoader
extends weka.core.converters.AbstractLoader
implements weka.core.converters.BatchConverter, weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.core.CommandlineRunnable
    Loads text files in a directory.
    First sub-directory level is used for the class attribute names, the second level for the labels for each class attribute.
    Due to the multi-label nature, documents need to be copied into multiple sub-directories. The loader uses the file's name (no path) as a unique ID to identify the copies.

    Example:
    /text-dataset
    /class1
    /0
    3.txt
    5.txt
    /1
    1.txt
    2.txt
    4.txt
    /class2
    /0
    1.txt
    4.txt
    /1
    2.txt
    3.txt
    5.txt

    Will generate something like this:

    @relation 'example: -C 2'

    @attribute @@class-class1@@ {0,1}
    @attribute @@class-class2@@ {0,1}
    @attribute file-ID string
    @attribute text string

    @data
    1,0,1.txt,'file 1\n'
    1,1,2.txt,'file 2\n'
    0,1,3.txt,'file 3\n'
    1,0,4.txt,'file 4\n'
    0,1,5.txt,'file 5\n'


    Valid options are: 

     -D
  Enables debug output.
  (default: off)
     -F
  Stores the filename in an additional attribute.
  (default: off)
     -dir <directory>
  The directory to work on.
  (default: current directory)
     -charset <charset name>
  The character set to use, e.g UTF-8.
  (default: use the default character set)
    Based on code from Weka's TextDirectoryLoader
    Author:
    fracpete (fracpete at waikato dot ac dot nz)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
